title: Coronation Street spoilers: Dying Sinead nears the end tonight
text:
Sinead Tinker (Katie McGlynn) was left devastated during Coronation Street last night when she discovered husband Daniel Osbourne’s (Rob Mallard) betrayal with Bethany Platt (Lucy Fallon). Tonight, she reels from the revelation, while coming to the realisation of how little time she’s actually got left.

Sinead was wracked with guilt during last night’ episode, as she believed looking after her was simply too much for Daniel to handle on his own. However, little did she know that he was also feeling incredibly guilty — only his guilt stemmed from the fact that he’d kissed Bethany.

While he deliberated over whether or not to tell his dying wife the truth, Sinead decided she’d move into a hospice, and while attempting to make a list of things she’d like to take with her, she stumbled upon Bethany’s notebook, and proceeded to read her short story.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The subtext of said story clearly indicated that Bethany was in love with him, and thus Sinead quizzed Daniel on the matter — and he finally admitted his betrayal. With Sinead and her family having thrown him out, Daniel went off and got drunk, before collapsing by the canal.

Tonight, Sinead wakes and remembers her row with Daniel — and becomes upset that he’s not with her. Knowing that she doesn’t have a lot of time left, she uses her alone time to record a series of special messages on Daniel’s laptop for Bertie, highlighting just how much she loves him.

Tracy (Kate Ford) pays Sinead a visit, and reminds her how much Bertie needs his father, before reminding her how much Daniel loves the both of them.

Daniel later shows up — but what will Sinead have to say to him?

Coronation Street continues Thursday 24thOctober at 8:30pm.

MORE: What day does Sinead die in Coronation Street?

MORE: 10 Coronation Street spoilers: Baby disaster, stabbing twist and collapse

description: Sinead Tinker struggles to come to terms with Daniel and Bethany's infidelity in Coronation Street, but she sadly is running out of time.
